programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Dordogne, the art of Prehistory A programme entirely devoted to prehistory in the Dordogne and its Vézère Valley, a Unesco world heritage site since 1979 for its numerous and exceptional prehistoric sites. We discover the Cussac Cave, closed to both television cameras and the general public, and whose prehistoric engravings are quite simply spectacular. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Foodstuffs confiscated by Customs
Each year, more than 40,000 foodstuffs are confiscated when going through Customs in Canada. So what exactly are you allowed to bring back, or not? A beer smoothie: a good mix? We also explore the world of sampling, and construction workers' lunchboxes.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: L'ancienne et la nouvelle pinacothèque de Munich Halte dans deux « temples » allemands, dédiés à l'art, appréciés pour la richesse de leurs collections. L'ancienne pinacothèque de Munich recèle un grand nombre de tableaux de peintres français de la période classique, de Claude Lorrain à Fragonard. La nouvelle pinacothèque abrite, elle, les artistes romantiques et impressionnistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Gard From the Cévennes Mountains to the low-lying wetlands of the Camargue, from Nîmes to Uzès or Aigues-Mortes, the department of the Gard offers a multitude of landscapes and historical sites. Holm oak, chestnut, grassy meadows... On the banks of the Gardon, en-route for Saint-Jean-du-Gard, nature could hardly be more luxuriant. Directed by: Pierre Chassagnieux (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Brouage, life in the marshes Just a few kilometres from Rochefort, the 11,000 hectares of the Brouage Marshes offer a landscape with a singular history, an area shaped both by the hand of man and by nature itself. With its wetlands providing fabulous reserves of biodiversity, the Brouage Marshes are also a haven for birds. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Apprendre le français grâce à l'Épicerie
programme.desc:
Learning French thanks to l'Épicerie
There's no shortage of viewers who have learnt French thanks to the programme. We share their stories! We also discover a café inspired by Scandinavia, a pupil- teacher reunion, tropical-style fried chicken and a surprise tribute to Denis Gagné for his final programme!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La National Gallery of Art, Washington Fondée en 1937, la National Gallery of Art, à Washington, est l'un des plus imposants musées au monde par l'importance des oeuvres présentées. Les collections sont réparties dans deux bâtiments distincts, reliés par une galerie sous le Mall. On y retrouvera les grands noms français de la peinture moderne. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Gard From the Cévennes Mountains to the low-lying wetlands of the Camargue, from Nîmes to Uzès or Aigues-Mortes, the department of the Gard offers a multitude of landscapes and historical sites. Holm oak, chestnut, grassy meadows... On the banks of the Gardon, en-route for Saint-Jean-du-Gard, nature could hardly be more luxuriant. Directed by: Pierre Chassagnieux (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays Bigouden
In the Pays Bigouden, Brittany, Lenny and Lucie present all the stages involved in their seaweed production, from collection to sale. Sara explains the phases in brewing beer, from hops to tasting. To end, we meet some of the bird-lovers helping birds to nest.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: America in Montbéliard! Montbéliard and the USA are two different lands yet closely links by the Franche-Comté origins of those who helped build America. In this special feature on the US in Montbéliard, the programme brings a touch of the New World to Doubs! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Les tortillas, une offre de plus en plus diversifiée
programme.desc:
Tortillas, an ever-wider range
An essential basic in Mexican cuisine, the humble corn tortilla is constantly evolving to offer ever more variety. Also on the programme: chef François-Xavier Bleau offers his handy hints for successful cooking over a wood fire, the science behind flavours and a close look at the iceberg lettuce.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Pasquale "Don Pasquale", the comic opera by Gaetano Donizetti and Giovanni Ruffini was performed for the first time at the Comédie-Italienne in Paris, in 1843. Damiano Michieletto made the opera his own when he produced it at the Opéra de Paris in 2018. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Tarn The department of the Tarn, in the Midi-Pyrénées region, holds the promise of innumerable marvels to discover. Albi la Rouge, named for the red brick of its town centre; Cordes-sur-Ciel, a "bastide" floating on the clouds; Gaillac, renowned for its vineyards; the picturesque village of Lautrec and its pink garlic. Directed by: Florent Quet (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Brouage, life in the marshes Just a few kilometres from Rochefort, the 11,000 hectares of the Brouage Marshes offer a landscape with a singular history, an area shaped both by the hand of man and by nature itself. With its wetlands providing fabulous reserves of biodiversity, the Brouage Marshes are also a haven for birds. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Present worldwide, Relais & Châteaux promotes the luxury hotel sector. Cooked upside down and eaten in situ: the Tatin pie, a mouthwatering mistake. The jewellery creator Annelise Michelson moves into design.. Wearing a tie. Akho: the brainchild of a designer launching an eco-responsible brand.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: The free life of a vegan nomad Joëlle, a vegan nomad, took the decision to abandon city life for the peace and quiet of the Rockies. Discussing her life with Julien, she sets out all the advantages of living in the great outdoors, surrounded by breathtaking scenery. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Île de Sumatra (Indonésie) Découverte du marché de Sumatra. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Tarn The department of the Tarn, in the Midi-Pyrénées region, holds the promise of innumerable marvels to discover. With its wetlands providing fabulous reserves of biodiversity, the Brouage Marshes are also a haven for birds. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Louvre
Measuring some 700 metres, the Rue du Louvre runs from the Rue de Rivoli to the Sentier district, crossing the 1st and 2nd arrondissements. Three of the street's best-known buildings have been given a complete facelift: the Bourse du Commerce, the Samaritaine and the legendary Poste Centrale.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken lasagne
Classic lasagne with a new twist for this chicken lasagne recipe with cauliflower purée and creamy cheese sauce.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Yvonnick Jegat, defending natural oysters
In his "garden" in the Gulf of Morbihan, Yvonnick Jegat cultivates the art of the natural oyster. He uses only sea-born baby oysters, known as spat, that are then raised on the sandy seabed. Maison Jegat, founded in 1925, is a pioneer in the defence of traditional oyster farming.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: La tradition du cuir par les maîtres gantiers
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Touraine Between Poitou and Charente, this land steeped in character offers much more than just magnificent châteaux on the banks of the Loire. It's also a region of gastronomy and fine wine, much-appreciated by tourists. From Azay-le-Rideau to the troglodyte valley of Les Goupillières, via the orchards of Rivarennes. Directed by: Dominique Lenglart (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Brouage, life in the marshes Just a few kilometres from Rochefort, the 11,000 hectares of the Brouage Marshes offer a landscape with a singular history, an area shaped both by the hand of man and by nature itself. With its wetlands providing fabulous reserves of biodiversity, the Brouage Marshes are also a haven for birds. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Soupe au maïs et au jalapeno et pain au maïs
programme.desc: Sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and corn bread Sweetcorn forms the base for Kimberly Lallouz' recipes as she prepares a sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and a corn bread roll. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Frédéric, Upper Laurentians Amélie, Frédéric and their two daughters felt they were suffocating in their home in Montréal. They moved to live on the banks of a river in the Upper Laurentians. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Own brands
Are own brands, generally sold at lower prices, good quality? Also on the programme: how to prepare tempeh, the Indonesian speciality made from fermented soybeans? Discovering all about Argentinean maté and the traditional Portuguese soup, caldo verde.
Presented by: Johane Despins.
